intro: Jagera dasyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved jagera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Jagera dasyantha is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
